documents.document: @bbclaurak This is a 2018 government sitting within such archaic rules & pomp that even tradition has become ludicrous. The mace’s connection, in *any* way, to the people this govt’s elected to serve does not exist. It’s meaningless & so begets meaningless behaviour in context.

@manwhohasitall Yes. It’s why it’s best that they don’t work, like women. Because we concentrate on bringing the money in, it leaves Dads all that free time to do all that - and more. However if they can work PT too - in an easy job like teaching, nursing or a shop, it’s quite nice for them.

@ophelia_rises And wine.
@thebelgianbun I’ll take the Bountys. 😭
@PatMcClay @DIfferent_Name2 History’s happening tho, isn’t it? At least we’ve not given any of it a pass.

@PatMcClay @DIfferent_Name2 The sadness is quite extreme at times. Life passing in a bit of a half-lived way. Often don’t know what to tell the kids when they ask for advice re what to do for best with their futures (16 & 18).
@PatMcClay @DIfferent_Name2 😂

@DIfferent_Name2 @PatMcClay Sitting here twiddling our thumbs, stockpiling tins of tomatoes and worrying everything we’ve worked for will go to shit. Felt an irrational surge of anger for IndyRef No voters this morning.
@DIfferent_Name2 @PatMcClay We’re boxed into a corner by unionists up here and racists down there. Let’s move to Ireland.
@DIfferent_Name2 @PatMcClay It’ll just be Corbyn howling at the moon. A GE will re-elect Tories, IMO, and delay 2nd EU ref. We could be sitting in this exact same position in a year, I think.
THE BOILER MAN IS GONE. THE BOILER IS STILL NOT FIXED.
@ophelia_rises Bring that round to mine and we’ll discuss the next sexist twat our feminist detective agency’s going to take off the streets.
Time to go Theresa, so <insert another elite twat’s name here> can step in and jump like a one-eyed, one-eared hobby horse through the next rings of fire.
@MacFloozy I STINK 🚿
THE BOILER MAN IS HERE ♥️🔥

From that, as usual, I feel sorry for PM & co. And more sorry they have influence over others. The apple thing always pissed me off. It was really a tooth grinder about wealth/the relativity of everyday worries and passions and feeling frightened & unseen. That’s it, I think. 🤔

Anyway seeing Piers Morgan and other folk doing their defensive horror on Gillette ad, etc. reminded me of that. That when you feel utterly unhopeful about life your ability to listen, reason, compromise etc. is impaired, over-sensitive at best.

I am sure I looked calm on the outside. Inside I was terrified, desperate for nothing to get worse. She reasoned re pesticides. I said, desperate, ‘maybe if folk remove all the pesticides from their diet immediately that’ll fuck them up too though, like withdrawals’.

I remember being in a supermarket with her and her saying, ‘just choose the organic fruit, it’s only a few pence more’. I was *so* anxious about money and everything I couldn’t open my mind to it at all. Then she wanted me to concede just on apples, I dug in deep. No.

When I was 24 & pregnant with son, I had awful ante-natal depression and extreme financial/security worries. A well-meaning family member was urging me to eat organic where poss at the time, yr 2000, when it wasn’t such a well known thing.

We got to look inside a house not far off this in Edinburgh once and there’s just nothing like it for historical context and inspiration re domesticity and the mechanics of social change.
@Bearded_Centaur ME TOO. So fatigued at this stage but every change is a lovely boost & motivation.

@BrynleyHeaven I think devotional. Presumably requested by homeowner at time of build or retrofitted? Am also intrigued by hardwood either side of lounge fireplace, does it slide back? Functional or balancing form? We need in to be nosey!
@BrynleyHeaven Wow! Some good pics. Was that a font in the hall?!?

I will be glad to find myself on the other end of today. Builders, window installers, and fingers crossed on boiler repair. 🤞🏼🤞🏼🤞🏼
@Archieislander @NotQuiteLight @wildernessflash But sometimes because of the fore work, prep, thinking, etc. we can’t help but produce polished. The recipient experience is hugely impactful.
@SalMcW @wildernessflash Yes! That line....! But all of it. Energising. Can bloody feel the neurons making new connections in my brain after this!!!!

@Archieislander @NotQuiteLight @wildernessflash Clare this is a triumph. :’-)) Your voice is so beautiful and the whole piece is polished AF. Must’ve been a huge amount of work - the sound editing is 👌🏼, too. Wow. You knock me off my huge feet! X

This is incredible. I want to experience this in a gallery too - immediately! There’s NOTHING like being out in the world in dark, especially as a woman, IMO. Despite the light you see and feel all your possibility and all your challenges. If you get a quiet min, @StacyBoldrick X https://t.co/j8zbqs4xAN
@jlhallwriter @BALovric That’s a gorgeous, important idea. I love it. I’d be very happy to share space on @TheGrantidote for women’s stories of this nature. Thank you X
@kirstofcomms I don’t want it to end! Also love the clear adoration and awe he has for his feminist wife. Totally cool bloke. 🖤
This is SO LOVELY. So much more than a book about writing, the small childhood stories and memories of his mum are so gorgeous. And also, writing GEMS. 🖤 https://t.co/5F7ouC2uto

@sjksanders @hasenschneck And 50k to fund it plus (a hoped for) 50k for charity. No. My heart is not won. Call it a personal challenge and acknowledge the support & compromises being made to enable it but the pish of glib ‘everyone can’ is just a HARD NO from me.

@KGuilaine This is so cool because 6 months is enough to do something potentially life changing for students. Also, with good diagrams they will share with peers & families & extend the benefit I’m sure.
@hoskas I do that too much! These big Bags for Life are too easy to overfill.
@claralaaraa I wanted to share this with you. I started reading it last night and it was comforting and maternal. X https://t.co/zdw3SVhgRn
@ClaireShrugged You are bloody brilliant for saying something at all, also that what you said was so concise. X

@KGuilaine Something on personal impact; identifying a sort of SWOT of self springs to mind, then parallel formulas, where poss, for capping/minimising W & T and using social structures, including routes of validation, to maximise S & O. I’d love to see this outside of uni environments too.

@hoskas Oh no! Did it swell up when it happened? I wonder if you hit a bone or if it’s muscular/tissue? I would try and work it out by prodding to see if there are tissue sore spots. If yes, vigorously massage them (will hurt) then ice pack for 20 mins nightly. Any swelling now =A&E.

“No Black woman writer in this culture can write “too much”. Indeed, no woman writer can write “too much”…No woman has ever written enough”
― bell hooks, remembered rapture: the writer at work https://t.co/mSrx3p3o5P
